result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Shyam R Soni was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 51 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 15 months.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs/Fee (transcript $10.00) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.

 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Count #2 was Dismissed.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend a Victim Impact Panel Meeting while on Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Earned Release Program completed and reviewed.  Order to release to Extended Supervision approved.
for amendment to judgment of conviction and order-ERP, received 11/14/16
received 11/14/16 from DOC requesting the conversion of the remaining confinement time to extended supervision

Defendant Shyam R Soni in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statements by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 5 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 2 years 6 months, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  Credit for 51 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 15 months.
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs of: $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- Transcript fee of $10.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Shyam R Soni in court with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and any ignition interlock device installed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
